Module.name: Wireless Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems

chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.section:
This Protection Profile Module () describes security requirements for a Wireless Intrusion Detection System () defined to be an IEEE 802.11 network intrusion detection product located at the edge of a private network that can collect, inspect, and analyze real-time network traffic and alert the administrator of policy violations. This is intended to provide a minimal baseline set of requirements that are targeted at mitigating well defined and described threats.
This Protection Profile Module () contains optional requirements for a Wireless Intrustion Protection System () a security product that provides network security administrators with the additional ability to react in real-time to potentially malicious wireless (IEEE 802.11) network traffic.
This is not complete in itself, but rather extends the collaborative Protection Profile for Network Devices (NDcPP). This introduction will describe the features of a compliant Target of Evaluation (), and will also discuss how this is to be used in conjunction with the NDcPP.

entry.description: Protection Profile used to build a PP-Configuration.
Common Criteria for Information Technology Security Evaluation (International Standard ISO/IEC 15408).

Within the context of the Common Criteria Evaluation and Validation Scheme (CCEVS), an IT security evaluation facility, accredited by the National Voluntary Laboratory Accreditation Program (NVLAP) and approved by the NIAP Validation Body to conduct Common Criteria-based evaluations.
Common Evaluation Methodology for Information Technology Security Evaluation.
An implementation-independent set of security requirements for a category of products.
A comprehensive set of security requirements for a product type that consists of at least one Base-PP and at least one PP-Module.
An implementation-independent statement of security needs for a type complementary to one or more Base Protection Profiles.
A requirement for security enforcement by the .
A set of implementation-dependent security requirements for a specific product.
The security functionality of the product under evaluation.
The security functionality of the product under evaluation.
A description of how a satisfies the s in an .
A device that provides the network interface that enables wireless client hosts to access a wired network.
A device that has the ability to process, transmit, and/or store information.
The primary name associated with an 802.11 wireless local area network (WLAN).
A security product that provides network security administrators with the ability to monitor, collect, and log real-time to potentially malicious wireless (IEEE 802.11) network traffic.
A security product that provides network security administrators with the ability to monitor, collect, log, and react in real-time to potentially malicious wireless (IEEE 802.11) network traffic.

section.title: Compliant Targets of Evaluation
section.subsection:
This specifically addresses Wireless Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems (/). A conformant / is a product that provides network security administrators with the ability to monitor, collect, log, and react in real-time to potentially malicious network traffic. A typically consists of multiple sensors that passively scan their surrounding RF environment on the radio frequency spectrum and a centralized mechanism such as a Server or Controller that processes the data collected by the sensors. The / could use an Embedded (be part of the infrastructure) or Overlay (independent from ) architecture depending on vendor implementation.
This is focused on inspecting layers 1 and 2 of the OSI network model as the traffic that the / monitors is wireless frames in the RF spectrum utilized by IEEE 802.11 a, b, g, n, and ac. Requirements for other technologies (e.g., cellular) and protocols are optional.
Conformant s will detect potentially malicious network traffic using various approaches. Broadly speaking, the traffic analysis could be based on identification of ‘known’ threats, or ‘unknown’ threats. Identification of ‘known’ threats may be performed through pattern matching, (e.g. by matching strings of characters within a frame with known patterns, or by matching traffic patterns common with reconnaissance or denial of service (DoS) attacks). Identification of ‘unknown’ threats may be performed through use of various forms of ‘anomaly’ detection whereby the / is provided with (or ‘learns’/creates) a definition of ‘expected/typical’ traffic patterns, such that it’s able to detect and react to ’anomalous’ (unexpected/atypical) traffic patterns.
The following are to be part of the evaluation:
Monitoring, detection and reporting capabilities offered by the .
Location Tracking.
Use of secure communication paths between components.
Use of secure communication paths for management and event monitoring.
Use of secure communication paths with external components (e.g., database and log server)

cclaim.title: Conformance Statement
cclaim.description:
This inherits exact conformance as required from the specified and as defined in the and addenda for Exact Conformance, Selection-Based SFRs, and Optional SFRs (dated May 2017).
The following PPs and s are allowed to be specified in a PP-Configuration with this .
Network Device cPP, version 2.1

cclaim.title: CC Conformance Claims
cclaim.description: This is conformant to Parts 2 (extended) and 3 (conformant) of Common Criteria Version 3.1, Release 5 [].

cclaim.title: Package Claims
cclaim.description: This does not claim conformance to any packages.

Module.chapter:
address a range of security threats related to detection of and reaction to potentially malicious traffic. The malicious traffic may pose a threat to one or more endpoints on the monitored networks, to the network infrastructure, or to the itself. Attacks against a could compromise the confidentiality and integrity of users and system data as well as the availability of the to legitimate users.
The term “monitored network” is used here to represent any and/or wired network that the is configured to monitor and detect intrusions on. This extends to the wired networks as intrusions on the wireless network can also be damaging to the wired infrastructure. The / also protect the wired infrastructure by detecting rogue devices that are directly connected to the wired infrastructure, which may expose the wired network, or unauthorized devices deployed in a no-wireless zone.
The terms "Wi-Fi", “Wi-Fi Network” and “” will be used interchangeably to represent a Wi-Fi network.
The proper installation, configuration, and administration of the are critical to its correct operation. A site is responsible for developing its security policy and configuring a rule set that the will enforce and provide an appropriate response to meet their needs, relative to their own risk analysis and their perceived threats.
Note that this does not repeat the threats identified in the NDcPP, though they all apply given the conformance and hence dependence of this on the NDcPP. Note also that while the NDcPP contains only threats to the ability of the to provide its security functions, this addresses only threats to resources in the operational environment. Together the threats of the NDcPP and those defined in this define the comprehensive set of security threats addressed by a .
Unintended/unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information on a protected , such as sending unencrypted sensitive data. The will be capable of collecting and analyzing data to detect unauthorized disclosure of information.
The threat T.Unauthorized_Disclosure_of_Information is countered by O.SYSTEM_MONITORING as this provides for visibility into the network which enables detection of network violations.
The threat T.Unauthorized_Disclosure_of_Information is countered by O.WIDS_ANALYZE as this provides detection of potential violations of approved network usage.
The threat T.Unauthorized_Disclosure_of_Information is countered by O.WIPS_REACT as this provides containment of unauthorized s and s.
An attacker may attempt to gain unauthorized access to a network, endpoints, or services, by methods such as impersonation of an authorized to get an to connect to the unauthorized If malicious external s or s are able to communicate with s or s on the protected , then those devices may be susceptible to the unauthorized disclosure of information.
The threat T.UNAUTHORIZED_ACCESS is countered by O.SYSTEM_MONITORING as this provides for visibility into the network which enables detection of unauthorized s and s.
The threat T.UNAUTHORIZED_ACCESS is countered by O.WIDS_ANALYZE as this provides detection of potential violations of approved network usage.
The threat T.UNAUTHORIZED_ACCESS is countered by O.WIPS_REACT as this provides containment of unauthorized s and s.
The threat T.UNAUTHORIZED_ACCESS is countered by O.TOE_ADMINISTRATION.
Attacks against the infrastructure might lead to denial of service (DoS) attacks within a protected . A wireless DoS may occur in two ways: at the physical layer through RF Jamming, or at the data link layer through packet injection.
The threat T.DISRUPTION is countered by O.SYSTEM_MONITORING as this provides for visibility into the network which enables detection of DoS attacks.
The threat T.DISRUPTION is countered by O.WIDS_ANALYZE as this provides for detection of potential violations of approved network usage.
The threat T.DISRUPTION is countered by O.WIPS_REACT as this provides containment of unauthorized s and s.
It is assumed that the is connected to distinct networks in a manner that ensures that the 's security policies will be enforced on all applicable network traffic flowing among the attached networks.
The operational environment objective OE.CONNECTIONS is realized through A.CONNECTIONS.
The administrator of the is not careless, willfully negligent or hostile, and administers the within compliance of the applied enterprise security policy.
The operational environment objective OE.PROPER_ADMIN is realized through A.PROPER_ADMIN.
An organization deploying the is expected to satisfy the organizational security policy listed below in addition to all organizational security policies defined by the claimed base PP.
Analytical processes and information to derive conclusions about potential intrusions must be applied to data and appropriate response actions taken.
The organizational security policy P.ANALYZE is facilitated through O.WIDS_ANALYZE.

chapter.title: Security Objectives

SO.description: To be able to analyze and react to potential network policy violations, the must be able to collect and store essential data elements of network traffic on monitored networks.

The must be able to analyze collected or observed activity on monitored network to identify potential violations of approved policies, unauthorized connections involving internal devices, and non-secure communications.
The must be able to react as configured by the administrators to isolate/contain devices that have been determined to violate administrator-defined policies.

To address the threat of unauthorized administrator access that is defined in the base PP, Conformant s will provide the functions necessary for an administrator to configure the Capabilities of the .

There may be instances where the ’s hardware malfunctions or the integrity of the ’s software is compromised, the latter being due to malicious or non-malicious intent. To address the concern of the operating outside of its hardware or software specification, the will log or produce an alert upon discovery of a problem reported via the self-test mechanism.
To further address the threat of untrusted communications channels that is defined in the base PP, conformant s will provide trusted communications between distributed components if any exist.

section.title: Security Objectives for the Operational Environment

chapter.section:
The following security objectives for the operational environment assist the in correctly providing its security functionality. These track the assumptions about the environment.
administrators will ensure that the is installed in a manner that will allow the to effectively enforce its policies on the network traffic of monitored networks.
The administrator of the is not careless, willfully negligent or hostile, and administers the within compliance of the applied enterprise security policy.

base-pp.name: Network Device

f-component.name: Basic Internal TSF Data Transfer Protection

f-element.title: Refinement: The shall use IPsec SSH TLS TLS/HTTPS with security strength commensurate with all other trusted communications to protect data from disclosure and modification when it is transmitted between separate parts of the .
f-element.note: This requirement ensures all communications between components of a distributed is protected through the use of an encrypted communications channel. The data passed in this trusted communication channel are encrypted as defined in the protocol chosen in the selection. The author chooses the mechanisms supported by the , and then ensures the appropriate requirements from the NDcPP corresponding to their selection are copied to the if not already present. For the purposes of this requirement, security strength is defined by NIST SP 800-57, “commensurate” means that the strengths must, at a minimum, meet the requirements for the cryptographic primitives listed in the , and “other trusted communications” refers to the mechanisms specified in FPT_ITC.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall examine the to determine that the methods and protocols used to protect distributed components are described. The evaluator shall also confirm that all protocols listed in the in support of administration are consistent with those specified in the requirement, and are included in the requirements in the .
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall confirm that the operationalbguidance contains instructions for establishing the communication paths for each supported method.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall also perform the following tests:
The evaluators shall ensure that communications using each specified (in the operational guidance) communications method is tested during the course of the evaluation, setting up the connections as described in the operational guidance and ensuring that communication is successful. The evaluator shall ensure, for each method of communication, the channel data is not sent in plaintext.
Further assurance activities are associated with the specific protocols.

f-element.title:
Refinement: The shall be capable of using IPsec SSH TLS HTTPS
to provide a trusted communication channel between itself and authorized IT entities supporting the following capabilities: audit server,
database server other capabilities none that is logically distinct from other communication channels and provides assured identification of its end points and protection of the channel data from disclosure and detection of modification of the channel data.
f-element.note: If the uses a separate database server, the database server selection must included in the .
f-element.aactivity:
The evaluator shall perform the following activities in addition to the assurance activity specified in the base NDcPP for this SFR:
The evaluator shall examine the to determine that, for all communications with authorized IT entities identified in the requirement, each communications mechanism is identified in terms of the allowed protocols for that IT entity. The evaluator shall also confirm that all protocols listed in the are specified and included in the requirements in the .
The evaluator shall confirm that the guidance documentation contains instructions for establishing the allowed protocols with each authorized IT entity, and that it contains recovery instructions should a connection be unintentionally broken.
The evaluators shall ensure that communications using each protocol with each authorized IT entity is tested during the course of the evaluation, setting up the connections as described in the guidance documentation and ensuring that communication is successful.
For each protocol that the can initiate as defined in the requirement, the evaluator shall follow the guidance documentation to ensure that in fact the communication channel can be initiated from the .
The evaluator shall ensure, for each communication channel with an authorized IT entity, the channel data is not sent in plaintext.
The evaluators shall, for each protocol associated with each authorized IT entity tested during test 1, physically interrupt an established connection. The evaluator shall ensure that when physical connectivity is restored, communications are appropriately protected.
Further assurance activities are associated with the specific protocols.

base-pp.con-toe: When this extends the Network Device cPP, the type for the overall is still / products.

f-element.title: The shall take [the following actions: display alert to Authorized Administrator in sufficient detail to show identity of s and s involved, description of alert and severity level, capture raw frame traffic that triggers the violation no other actions ] upon detection of a potential security violation.
f-element.note: The capturing of raw frames that triggers the violation is an objective requirement. If the author selects capturing of raw frames that triggers the violation, the author must include .

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes where to find the alerts on the Administrator console/interface.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall use the operational guidance for instructions on where the alerts generated are displayed within the interface. If the objective requirement to capture the raw frame that triggered an alert is selected, the evaluator must also test for corresponding selection-based requirements. The evaluator shall use the operational guidance to configure the traffic capture capabilities.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following tests:
The evaluator shall perform a series of events or generate traffic that would successfully trigger an alert. The evaluator should verify and record whether the generated the alert. The evaluator should also record the events or traffic that was generated and what alert was attempted to be triggered and record the details provided by the in the alert.
If capturing of raw frames was selected, verify that the packet capture was triggered and stored as appropriate.

f-element.title: The shall provide the ability to apply methods of selection to selectively exclude alerts from being generated.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the ability of the to transmit alerts.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance includes instructions on enabling and disabling alerts.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following tests:
The evaluator shall use the operational guidance to enable/disable detection of available detection capabilities through the administrator interface. The evaluator shall then generate traffic that would successfully trigger the alert. The evaluator should verify that the generated the alert. The evaluator shall record the attack/intrusion that was generated and indicate which alert was triggered as well as the details that were provided by the about the alert.
The evaluator shall disable the alert. The evaluator shall then generate events as in previous test that should successfully trigger the alert. The evaluator should check if the generated an alert for the attack and record the findings.

f-element.title:
The shall be able to generate an audit record of the following auditable events:
Start-up and shutdown of the audit functions;
All auditable events for the [not specified] level of audit;
[Auditable events listed in ;
Failure of wireless sensor communication].

f-element.note:
The auditable events defined in are for the SFRs that are explicitly defined in this PP-Module and are intended to extend FAU_GEN.1 in the Base-PP. The events in the should be combined with those of the ND cPP in the context of a conforming Security Target.
The Auditable Events () includes optional and objective SFRs. The auditing of optional and objective SFRs is only required if that SFR is included in the .

aactivity.TSS: There are no assurance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
The evaluator shall test the ’s ability to correctly generate audit records by having the generate audit records in accordance with the assurance activities associated with the functional requirements in this . When verifying the test results, the evaluator shall ensure the audit records generated during testing match the format specified in the administrative guide, and that the fields in each audit record have the proper entries.
Note that the testing here can be accomplished in conjunction with the testing of the security mechanisms directly.

f-component.name: Intrusion Detection System – Intrusion Detection and Reporting Methods

f-element.title:
The shall provide the following methods of intrusion detection:
anomaly-based signature-based behavior-based hybrid proprietary vendor detection method
f-element.note:
At least one detection method must be selected. Based on the selection made in this SFR, the following SFRs must also be included:
If anomaly-based detection is selected: and
If signature-based detection is selected:
A hybrid detection method is one that incorporates two or more detection methods (e.g., both anomaly and signature based or signature and another method). If one of the detection methods in a hybrid solution includes either anomaly-based or signature-based detection methods, the corresponding selection based requirements must also be met.

f-element.title:
The TSF shall provide Syslog using defined API Syslog other detection method
SNMP trap reporting using defined API Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) other detection method
.
f-element.note: Syslog and/or SNMP trap reporting can be used. At least one reporting method must be selected.

f-element.title:
The TSF shall provide the ability to import data from the system:
custom API Syslog proprietary vendor detection method (e.g. Splunk)
f-element.note: The system shall provide the ability to interact with an extensible interface to a custom proprietary or third party wireless monitoring system for the purposes of importing data from the wireless system. At least one detection method must be selected.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes guidance on which intrusion detection technique(s) the utilizes. If a hybrid intrusion detection is selected as the intrusion detection method, the should provide details on the detection techniques utilized. Furthermore, when using a hybrid detection method that includes detection methods other than anomaly or signature based, the shall include more details about such detection methods. If proprietary vendor detection method is selected, technical details on the method must be provided.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides instructions on how to configure the in order for it to detect such intrusions.
aactivity.Tests: Depending on the detection technique used by the the evaluator shall note detection technique used and test for the appropriate selection-based requirements.

f-element.title: The shall provide Authorized Administrators with the ability to define an inventory of [authorized s and s] based on [EUD MAC addresses, MAC addresses].
f-element.note: This inventory is used as a whitelist to indicate to the which s and s are legitimate members of the wireless network. The terminology used to describe an inventoried or whitelisted device may vary by vendor product. This utilizes whitelisted to describe s and s that are part of the inventory and non-whitelisted to describe s and s that are not part of the inventory.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall review the to verify that it includes information the ability of the to define inventory of authorized s and s.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall review the operational guidance for instructions on how to configure and change clasification of s and s to indicate that they are part of the whitelist.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following tests:
Deploy an and that should be classified as authorized devices.
If the whitelist is configured automatically:
Check the list of whitelisted devices and verify that the list is correct.
Verify that the devices are classified as whitelisted.
Remove or reclassify a device from the inventory.
Verify that the device is not marked as whitelisted after removing or reclassifying.
If the set of authorized devices is configured manually:
Add an and to the list. Record whether and are displayed on the inventory.
Verify that the devices are classified as whitelisted in the list of whitelisted devices.
Remove the from the inventory.
Verify that the removed device does not appear in the inventory after removal.

f-element.title: The shall detect the presence and current information of[EUDs, s] in the Operational Environment that are part of the defined inventory.
f-element.note: When referring to current information that should be detected by the , it is referring to information about the detected or as is observed by the such as operating channel and band, SSID of an , client(s) connected to an , and the that an is connected to. has a full list of the details about the or that should be detected by the .

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes how the presence of authorized s and s is presented by the and what information about the devices is provided.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides instructions on how to view authorized s and s that are within range of the sensors.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following tests:
Deploy a whitelisted and , and connect the to the . Verify that the list of detected s and s contains the whitelisted and that were just deployed. If the and are detected verify that they are classified as whitelisted devices.

f-element.title: The shall detect the presence and current information of [EUDs, s] in the Operational Environment that are not part of the defined inventory.
f-element.note: When referring to current information that should be detected by the , it is referring to information about the detected or as is observed by the such as operating channel and band, SSID of an , client(s) connected to an , and the that an is connected to. has a full list of the details about the or that should be detected by the .

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes guidance on where in the interface the list of detected s and s is displayed.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides instructions on how to view unauthorized s and s that are within range of the sensors.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following tests:
Deploy a non-whitelisted and and connect the to the . Verify that the list of detected s and s contains the non-whitelisted and that were just deployed. If the and are detected verify that they are not classified as whitelisted devices.

f-element.title: The shall detect information on the current physical location of [inventoried and malicious s, s] within [range of the ’s wireless sensors].
f-element.note:
This SFR only checks for the ability of the to track the location of s and s either by placing them on a map or providing the distance of the or from the sensor but does not mandate a certain degree of accuracy.
Objective requirement is more stringent on the accuracy of the location tracking capabilities.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes information on location tracking, optimal number of sensors and sensor placement to meet the required level of accuracy.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall review the operational guidance for instructions on how to configure location tracking and where in the administrator interface the location of s and s can be viewed.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
Deploy an within range of the sensors. Verify that is able to provide location information on the . Verify that the location presented by the appears within the range of the sensors.

f-element.title: The shall detect [received signal strength, RF power levels above a predetermined threshold no other characteristics ] of hardware operating within [range of the ’s wireless sensors].

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the contains information regarding the ’s ability to record signal strength of hardware operating within range of its sensors.
aactivity.Guidance: If the option for detection of RF power levels above a predetermined threshold is selected, the evaluator shall use the operational guidance to set or check what the threshold is in a given test. The evaluator should also verify that the operational guidance provides instruction on how to configure the to generate an alert when the threshold is exceeded.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
Deploy an within range of the sensors. Check the user interface for a list of detected s and s. Verify that the current received signal strength is part of the information presented on the user interface about the s and s.

f-element.title: The shall detect the current RF band, current channel, MAC Address, classification of s and s, other details of [all s and s] within range of the ’s wireless sensors. For [s] the shall detect the following additional details: encryption, number of connected s. For [s] the shall detect the following additional details: SSID and BSSID of it is connected to.
f-element.note: For detection of encryption type, the should be able to differentiate between the different encryption methods and when no encryption is in use.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the explains the capability of detecting the current RF band, current channel, MAC Address, classification of s and s within the ’s wireless range.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall review the operational guidance in order to verify that there are instructions that show how to locate the device inventory mentioned above.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
Deploy a whitelisted , non-whitelisted and two whitelisted s. Connect one whitelisted to the whitelisted and one to the non-whitelisted . Check the user interface for a list of detected s and s. Verify that current RF band, current channel, MAC Address, classification of device, are part of the information presented on the user interface for all the s and s detected. For s verify that encryption, number of connected s is presented. For s verify that the SSID and BSSID of it is connected is presented.

f-element.title:
The shall detect when [inventoried s] exhibit the following behavior: An establishes a peer-to-peer connection with any other .
An bridges two network interfaces An uses internet connection sharing other connection types no other connections
f-element.note: For this requirement, it is acceptable for the to use a generic terms for bridges or peer-to-peer connections when generating an alert for the detection of different types of bridges or peer-to-peer connections. The type of connection does not have to be specific.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the ability of the to detect the network behavior described by the SFR.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall review the operational guidance to verify that it provides instructions on how alerts are presented to the administrator as well as information regarding the format of each alert.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following tests:
Create the following connections between two whitelisted s.
Windows Ad Hoc Connection
Mac OS Ad Hoc
Linux Ad Hoc
Wi-Fi Direct
Create the following connections between one whitelisted and a non-whitelisted
Windows Ad Hoc Connection
Mac OS Ad Hoc
Linux Ad Hoc
Wi-Fi Direct
(Optional) Bridge two network interfaces on a whitelisted (one must be the wireless card listed as whitelisted).
Create a Windows Hosted Network with a whitelisted .
Connect a different whitelisted to the network.
Verify that alerts were generated by each of the connections in each test. Provide a description of the alert.

f-element.title: The shall be able to apply a set of rules for monitoring the wireless traffic and based upon these rules indicate a potential malicious action.

aactivity.TSS: There are no assurance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Tests: There are no tests for this SFR, testing detection of potential malicious events is tested through the ability to detect intrusions in other SFRs.

f-element.title:
The shall enforce the following rules for monitoring wireless traffic:
Accumulation or combination of [assignment: subset of defined auditable events] known to indicate a potential security violation;
[other potential security violations as defined by ].
SFR Potential Security Violation.
Detection of authorized establishing peer-to-peer connection with any other .
Detection of bridging two network interfaces.
Detection of rogue .
Detection of malicious .
Detection of traffic with excessive transmit power level.
Detection of active probing.
Detection of MAC spoofing.
Detection of RF-based denial of service.
Detection of deauthentication flooding.
Detection of disassociation flooding.
Detection of request-to-send/clear-to-send abuse.
Detection of unauthorized authentication scheme use.
Detection of unauthorized encryption scheme use.
Detection of unencrypted traffic.
: Potential Security Violations

aactivity.TSS: There are no assurance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Tests: There are no tests for this SFR, testing of monotoring capabities is tested through the ability to detect intrusions in other SFRs.

f-component.name: Wireless Intrusion Detection – Malicious Environmental Objects

f-element.title: The shall apply user-defined, automatic classification rules to detect the following types of malicious environmental objects: [rogue s].

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes how the can detect rogue s and whether this behavior is configurable.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall review the operational guidance for instructions on how to configure user-defined classification rules, if supported.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform configure an classifcation rule, then perform the following test:
Deploy an following the user-defined classification rule.
Verify that the gets correctly classified.

f-element.title: The shall distinguish between benign and malicious [s, s] based on [automatic detection metrics].

aactivity.TSS: There are no assurance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
Deploy a non-whitelisted in the area of the sensor but take no action against the network.
Deploy a non-whitelisted in the area of the sensor and connect it to the internal wired infrastructure (optional for overlay ).
Connect a whitelisted to a non-whitelisted .
Connect a non-whitelisted to a whitelisted .
Launch an attack against authorized with an unauthorized .
For each step above verify that the detects s and s and that they are classified appropriately.

f-component.name: Wireless Intrusion Detection – Passive Information Flow Monitoring

f-element.title:
The shall monitor and analyze
simultaneously monitor and analyze no other behavior network traffic matching the [802.11 monitoring ] for all channels in the following RF Frequencies: 2.4 GHz and 4.9/5.0 GHz
channels outside regulatory domain non-standard channel frequencies no other domains .
f-element.note: The "802.11 monitoring SFP" is a security function policy and the SFRs that reference this policy describe what the policy does. The "802.11 monitoring SFP" is established in and defined through SFRs. A vendor does not have to formally define this policy, it only needs to comply with the SFRs.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes information on the channels the can detect.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall review the operational guidance for the channels that the is able to monitor and how to configure the to monitor the channels as selected in the SFR. Depending on the channel dwelling times implemented by the vendor it might take a while for the detection of devices.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following tests:
Channels on On 5GHz band
Configure the to monitor the channels as selected in the SFR. Deploy on at least 2 different channels within the regulatory domain on 5GHz band. Deploy on at least 2 different channels outside the regulatory domain on 5GHz band. Verify that the gets detected on each channel tested.
Channels on 2.4GHz band
Configure the to monitor the channels as selected in the SFR. Deploy on at least 2 different channels within the regulatory domain on 2.4GHz band. Deploy on at least 2 different channels outside the regulatory domain on 2.4GHz band. Verify that the gets detected on each channel tested.
Non-standard channel frequencies
Configure the to monitor the channels as selected in the SFR. Deploy on at least 2 different channels on non-standard channel frequencies. Verify that the gets detected on each channel tested.

f-element.title:
The shall provide wireless sensors to detect network traffic matching the [802.11 monitoring ] that
can be configured to prevent transmission of data does not transmit data .
f-element.note:
The intent of this SFR is to employ sensors that can have all wireless transmission capabilities disabled for instances where a site wishes to implement a no wireless policy.
The "802.11 monitoring SFP" is a security function policy and the SFRs that reference this policy describe what the policy does. The "802.11 monitoring SFP" is established in and defined through SFRs. A vendor does not have to formally define this policy, it only needs to comply with the SFRs.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes information on how to configure the sensors as completely passive. Specifically, the shall indicate whether the can configured as a dedicated sensor with prevention disabled, or, if the sensor transmits data even with no prevention capabilities are enabled, how to disable wireless transmissions.
aactivity.Guidance: Specifically, the shall indicate whether the can configured as a dedicated sensor with prevention disabled, or, if the sensor transmits data even with no prevention capabilities are enabled, how to disable wireless transmissions.
aactivity.Tests:
If the provides the ability to disable wireless transmission, the evaluator shall follow the operational guidance to configure the sensor to not transmit wirelessly. The evaluator shall then deploy a signal analyzer in order to check for wireless emanations from the .
The evaluator shall then perform the following tests:
Deploy a signal analyzer and configure on the bands specified in the tests below. On 2.4 GHz band
Boot a sensor and using the signal analyzer observe to check if any eminations are coming from the sensor. Verify that the signal analyzer does not pick up emanations from the sensor.
During normal sensor operations, observe the analyzer for about 10 minutes to check if any eminations are coming from the sensor. Verify that the signal analyzer does not pick up emanations from the sensor.
On 5GHz band
Boot a sensor and using the signal analyzer observe to check if any eminations are coming from the sensor. Verify that the signal analyzer does not pick up emanations from the sensor.
During normal sensor operations, observe the analyzer for about 10 minutes to check if any eminations are coming from the sensor. Verify that the signal analyzer does not pick up emanations from the sensor.

f-element.title: The shall provide the ability to define a subset of [SSID(s)] as authorized.
f-element.note: The administrator should have the ability to configure which SSIDs are permitted on the network.

aactivity.TSS: No assurance activity specified.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the includes instructions on how to set the allowed SSIDs.
aactivity.Tests: The evaluator shall configure the with a set of authorized channels and SSIDs. The ability to detect violation of this policy will be tested in .

f-element.title:
The shall detect the presence of unauthorized traffic on the network through the following methods: [
detection of unauthorized s broadcasting authorized SSIDs,
detection of s and s spoofing the MAC address of whitelisted s and s,
detection of authorized s associating to unauthorized SSIDs,
detection of unauthorized s associating to authorized s,
detection of unauthorized point to point wireless bridges by whitelisted s,
detection of active probing,
illegal state transitions protocol violations
802.11 802.1X proprietary vendor protocol(s)
no other methods.
]
f-element.note: “Authorized” s/s are those that are assigned to the whitelist as defined by . Detection of illegal state transitions and protocol violations are objective requirements and will be mandatory in future PP versions.

f-element.title: The TSF shall perform stateful frame inspection and log attacks spanning multiple frames.
f-element.note: Adversaries possess the capability to distribute an attack across multiple frames in an attempt to avoid traditional detection measures that solely focus on packet headers. Stateful frame inspection will allow for the identification of obfuscation techniques centered around spreading an attack across multiple frames. Detection of illegal state transitions and protocol violations are objective requirements and will be mandatory in future PP versions.

f-element.title: The TSF shall detect a violation in allowing NULL associations.
f-element.note: The 802.11 standard allows s to beacon with the field set to null - this is referred to as a hidden or cloaked . The client seeking to associate with an using a hidden must first send out a Probe Request that contains the of that network, then the will return with a Probe Request of its own. The needs to be able to detect if an is allowing clients to associate without providing the valid of the .

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the methods that the uses to detect the presence of unauthorized connections and unauthorized network traffic.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides instructions on how to configure SSIDs as authorized.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall configure the with a set of authorized SSIDs and perform the following tests:
Unauthorized SSID, Unauthorized Connections - 2.4 GHz band
Configure a whitelisted to operate on a set channel on the 2.4 GHz band with an authorized SSID. Connect a non-whitelisted to . Verify that the detects the non-whitelisted connecting to the whitelisted . hange the 's SSID to one not on the authorized list. Connect a whitelisted to . Verify that the detects the whitelisted using unauthorized SSID and the associating to an unauthorized SSID.
Unauthorized SSID, Unauthorized Connections - 5 GHz band
Configure a whitelisted to operate on a set channel on the 5 GHz band with an authorized SSID. Connect a non-whitelisted to . Verify that the detects the non-whitelisted connecting to the whitelisted . hange the 's SSID to one not on the authorized list. Connect a whitelisted to . Verify that the detects the whitelisted using unauthorized SSID and the associating to an unauthorized SSID.
MAC Spoofing
Spoof mac address of whiteliste connected to a whitelisted on a second .
Connect with spoofed MAC address to another whitelisted while the valid it is spoofing is connected to the first .
Verify that the detected the MAC spoofing.
Spoof mac address of whiteliste on a second .
Verify that the detected the MAC spoofing.
Active Probing
Perform an active scan on the subnet of the .
Record tools used and type of scan performed. Verify that the detects the active probing.
Point-to-Point Wireless Bridges
Setup a point-to-point wireless bridge using whitelisted s in the range of the wireless sensors.
Verift that the detects the bridge.

f-component.name: Wireless Intrusion Detection – Denial of Service

f-element.title:
The shall detect the following intrusions: RF-based denial of service, deauthentication flooding, disassociation flooding, other DoS methods,
request-to-send/clear-to-send abuse no other DoS methods

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall examine the to verify that it describes the denial of service attacks that can be detected by the .
aactivity.Guidance: If the ability of the to detect different types of denial of service attacks is configurable, the evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides instructions on how to specify the attack(s) that are detected.

h:ul.h:li: Deploy whitelisted and configure to stay in a particular channel.
Connect a whitelisted to the .
Use an RF Jammer or signal generator on the same frequency as the and to create a DoS.
Verify that the detects the RF-based DoS.
Deploy whitelisted and configure to a set channel.
Connect a whitelisted to the .
Send an flood of deauthentication frames to the using the MAC address of whitelisted it is connected to.
Verify that the detects the deauthentication flood.
Send an flood of deauthentication frames with the MAC address of whitelisted as the source and destination as a broadcast.
Verify that the detects the deauthentication flood.
Deploy whitelisted and configure to a set channel.
Connect two whitelisted s to the .
Send an flood of CTS frames to reserve RF medium.
Verify that the detects the CTS abuse.

f-component.name: Wireless Intrusion Detection – Unauthorized Authentication Schemes

f-element.title: The shall provide Authorized Administrators the ability to define authorized authentication schemes.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the ability of the to allow authorized administrators to define authorized authentication schemes.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall examine the operational guidance to verify that it provides instructions on how to define a authentication scheme as authorized or unauthorized for the purposes of detection.
aactivity.Tests: The evaluator shall configure the with a set of authorized authentication schemes. The ability to detect violation of this policy will be tested in .

f-element.title: The shall detect when [whitelisted s and s defined in ] attempt to use authentication schemes that are not authorized.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the ability of the to detect when unauthorized authentication schemes are used.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall configure the with 802.1x authentication as the only mode of authorized authentication schemes and perform the following tests:
Deploy a whitelisted with open authentication.
Connect a whitelisted to .
Verify that the detects the and the using unauthorized authentication schemes.
Deploy a whitelisted that uses pre-shared key authentication.
Connect a whitelisted to .
Verify that the detects the and the using unauthorized authentication schemes.

f-component.name: Wireless Intrusion Detection – Unauthorized Encryption Schemes

f-element.title: The shall provide Authorized Administrators the ability to define authorized encryption schemes.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the ability of the to allow authorized administrators to define authorized encryption schemes.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall examine the operational guidance to verify that it provides instructions on how to define a encryption scheme as authorized or unauthorized for the purposes of detection.
aactivity.Tests: The evaluator shall configure the with a set of allowed encryption schemes. The ability to detect violation of this policy will be tested in .

f-element.title: The shall detect when [whitelisted s and s defined in ] attempt to use encryption schemes that are not authorized.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the ability of the to detect when unauthorized encryption schemes are used.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall configure the with 128 bit AES encryption type as the only allowd encryption scheme and perform the following test:
Deploy a whitelisted with no encryption.
Connect a whitelisted to .
Verify that the detects the and the using unauthorized encryption schemes.
Deploy a whitelisted that uses TKIP encryption only.
Connect a whitelisted to .
Verify that the detects the and the using unauthorized encryption schemes.

f-element.title: The shall detect when [whitelisted s and s defined in ] send or receive unencrypted data.
f-element.note: When referring to unencrypted data being received by a whitelisted or it refers to unencrypted data being sent to a whitelisted or from either a non-whitelisted or whitelisted or .

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the ability of the to detect when unauthorized s and s send or receive unencrypted data.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.

h:ul.h:li: Deploy a whitelisted with no encryption.
Connect a whitelisted to and generate traffic.
Verify that the detects unencrypted data frames being sent between the whitelisted and .
Connect a non-whitelisted to and generate traffic.
Verify that the detects unencrypted data frames being sent between the whitelisted and non-whitelisted .
Deploy a non-whitelisted with no encryption.
Connect a whitelisted to and generate traffic.
Verify that the detects unencrypted data frames being between the non-whitelisted and whitelisted .

f-element.title:
The shall enforce the [802.11 monitoring ] for [all IEEE 802.11 a, b, g, n, ac frame types and subtypes between:
authorized s and authorized s
authorized s and unauthorized s
unauthorized s and authorized s].
f-element.note:
“Authorized” s/APs are those that are assigned to the whitelist as defined by .
The "802.11 monitoring SFP" is a security function policy and the SFRs that reference this policy describe what the policy does. The "802.11 monitoring SFP" is established in and defined through SFRs. A vendor does not have to formally define this policy, it only needs to comply with the SFRs.

aactivity.TSS: There are no assurance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Guidance: If this functionality is configurable, the evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides instructions on how to configure the to monitor different types of IEEE 802.11 frame types and subtypes.

h:ul.h:li: Set the sensor for a set channel
Start a traffic capture from the sensor

Send a set number of frames on the channel the sensor's operating channel for all IEEE 802.11 a, b, g, n, ac frame types and subtypes from/to the following:
authorized s and authorized s
authorized s and unauthorized s
unauthorized s and authorized s ]
Verify that there are frames from all the types and subtypes in the capture.

f-element.title:
The shall be capable of performing the following management functions for functionality: [management functions listed in ].
SFR Management Function
Specification of periods of network activity that constitute baseline of expected behavior (optional).
: Management Functions

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes how the baseline can be configured.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance describes the instructions for defining a baseline.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
Following the instructions in the operatinal guidance verify that the period of network activity that constitutes a baseline can indicated in the .

f-component.name: Wireless Intrusion Detection – Wireless Spectrum Monitoring

f-element.title:
The shall detect the presence of network devices that operate in the following RF bands:
3.6 GHz 60 GHz sub-GHz (0-900 MHz) all cellular bands
f-element.note: This SFR refers to Non-Wi-Fi (IEEE 802.11 a, b, g, n, and ac) network devices that operate in the specified frequencies. If the author selects detection of devices in the cellular bands, the author must include selection-based requirement .

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes the set of RF bands and technologies that the can detect the use of. The should also include instructions on how to enable and the hardware that is necessary for the additional band detection.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance describes how to enable and configure detection of the technologies included in the as well as the hardware that is needed to perform this function.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall enable and configure detection of the selected technologies.
Deploy a device within the given technology and verify that the detects the device.

f-element.title: The shall provide a dedicated sensor for wireless spectrum analysis.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the to verify that the provides a dedicated sensor for wireless spectrum analysis.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance describes how to enable and configure dedicated spectrum analysis as well as the hardware that is needed to perform this function.
aactivity.Tests: The evaluator shall enable and configure dedicated spectrum analysis and test the capabilities listed in the .

f-element.title: The shall detect the physical location of [detected cellular devices] to within distance degree of accuracy of their actual location.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes information on the ’s ability to detect the physical location of cellular devices.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall review the operational guidance for instructions on how to configure location tracking, how to load a location map (if applicable), and where in the administrator interface the location of devices can be viewed.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following tests:
Deploy a cellular device within range of the sensors. Verify that the is able to track the location of the device. Verify the level of accuracy indicated by the falls within the one indicated in the assignment.

f-element.title:
The shall support the definition of
baselines (‘expected and approved’) anomaly (‘unexpected’) traffic patterns including the specification of
throughput ([assignment: data elements (e.g. bytes, packets, etc.) per time period (e.g. minutes, hours, days)]) time of day frequency; thresholds other methods
and the following network protocol fields:
all management and control frame header elements

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the composition and construction of baselines or anomaly-based attributes specified in the SFR. The evaluator shall verify that the provides a description of how baselines are defined and implemented by the , or a description of how anomaly-based rules are defined and configured by the administrator.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance describes how to configure baseline and/or anomalous traffic patterns based on what is claimed in the .

h:ul.h:li: The evaluator shall use the instructions in the operational guidance to configure baselines or anomaly-based rules
The evaluator shall send traffic that does not match the baseline or matches the anomaly-based rule and verify the detects the anomalous behavior and generates an alert.

f-element.title:
The shall support the definition of anomaly activity through
manual configuration by administrators automated configuration .
f-element.note: The “baseline” and “anomaly” can be something manually defined/configured by a administrator (or importing definitions), or something that the is able to automatically define/create by inspecting network traffic over a period of time (a.k.a. “profiling”).

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the available modes of configuration (manual or automatic) and how to configure or import the baseline.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance describes how to perform automatic and/or manual definition of anomaly activity based on what is selected in the .
aactivity.Tests: This test may be performed in conjunction with . The evaluator shall follow the operational guidance and define anomaly activity through automated and/or manual means based on what is selected in the . The evaluator shall verify in each case that the anomaly activity is defined correctly by determining that anomalous traffic is identified by the .

f-element.title: The shall support user-defined and customizable attack signatures.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the user-defined and customizable attack signatures that the can define.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides information on how to configure user-defined and customizable attack signatures, including a description of the customization options that are available.

steplist.step: Craft a signature with the available fields indicated in the .
Send a crafted frame that matches the signature to a whitelisted
Verify that the triggers an alert based on the newly defined signature.

f-element.title: The shall be able to transmit the generated packet captures to an external IT entity using a trusted channel according to FTP_ITC.1.
f-element.note: FTP_ITC.1 is inherited from the NDcPP.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the include the list of trusted channels (as specified in FTP_ITC.1) available in the to transmit packet captures to an external entity. The shall also include instructions on how to configure the trusted channel.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.

testlist.test: The evaluator shall configure packet captures according to the guidance specified in the . The evaluator shall then trigger an event that starts a capture and verify through the tests in FTP_ITC.1 that the captured traffic being sent to the external device is being sent through a trusted channel.

f-element.title: The shall be able to store generated packet captures on the itself.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the ability of the to store packet capture data within itself.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides information on how much storage space is available for packet capture data and where that data is stored.

testlist.test: The evaluator shall configure packet captures to be stored on the according to the guidance specified in the . The evaluator shall then trigger an event that starts a capture and verify that the packet capture was stored on the .

f-element.title:
The shall
drop new packet capture data overwrite previous packet captures according to the following rule rule for overwriting previous packet captures
other action
when the local storage space for packet capture data is full.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the behavior of the when local storage space for packet capture data is exhausted and whether this behavior is configurable.
aactivity.Guidance: If the behavior of the when local storage space for packet capture data is exhausted is configurable, the evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides information on what the configurable behaviors are and how they can be set.

testlist.test: The evaluator shall define packet data retention and deletion rules on the as specified in the and test the functionality of the specified rules.

f-element.title: The shall detect the physical location of [s, s] to within [15 feet] of their actual location.
The shall include a signal library.
f-element.note: The TSF will need to have the ability to import, export, or update the exisiting signal library.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes information on location tracking, optimal number of sensors and sensor placement to meet the required level of accuracy.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall review the operational guidance for instructions on how to configure location tracking, how to load a location map (if applicable), and where in the administrator interface the location of s and s can be viewed.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
Deploy an within range of the sensors. Verify the TS provides location tracking information about the . Verify the location presented is within 15 feet actual location.

f-element.title: The shall detect when [non-whitelisted s as defined in ] have the following connections: [wired connection to the internal corporate network].

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes guidance on whether the has the capability of detecting s connecting to the protected wired network infrastructure. If the capability is present the shall include configuration guidance for this feature.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall review the operational guidance for instructions on how to configure the to detect unauthorized s connected to the protected wired infrastructure.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
Deploy a non-whitelisted . Connect the via wire to the protected network infrastructure. Check the user interface for a list of detected s and s. Verify that the rogue is detected and an alert generated on the detection of an connected to the protected wired infrastructure.

f-element.title: The shall detect when two sensors in non-overlapping locations receive traffic from the same MAC address simultaneously.
f-element.note: The intent of this SFR is to detect MAC spoofing where an attacker is able to cause the whitelisted to disconnect and promptly connects a non-whitelisted device using the MAC address of the whitelisted .

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the describes the behavior of the when two sensors in non-overlapping locations receive traffic from the same MAC address simultaneously.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides instructions on how to deploy the in a manner that allows the to detect when two sensors in non-overlapping locations receive traffic from the same MAC address simultaneously (i.e. information about the range and placement of sensors to ensure non-overlapping coverage).
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
Setup a whitelisted (Location 1). Connect a whitelisted to . Setup a second whitelisted and a non-whitelisted in a separate non-overlapping location where the also has sensors. Or simulate the distant non-verlapping locations by deploying the second in a shielded environment connected to the valid network (Location 2). Spoof the MAC address of the in location 1 with the in location 2 and connect it to the whitelisted in location 2. Make sure both s are connected at the same time. Verify that the detected and generated an alert.

f-element.title: The shall detect when two sensors in non-overlapping locations receive traffic from the MAC addresses of [non-whitelisted s as defined in ] within [an Authorized administrator-configurable timeframe based on distance between sensors].
f-element.note: The intent of this SFR is to allow the administrator to determine the time that should be allowed between a whitelisted connecting in two distant locations.

aactivity.TSS: There are no assurance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides instructions on how to configure the timeframe that should be allowed between two subsequent attempts for an to connect from two separate locations.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
Configure the timeframe allowed between connection of two s in two separate locations (Location 1, Location 2). Setup a whitelisted (Location 1). Connect a whitelisted to . Setup a second whitelisted and a non-whitelisted in a separate non-overlapping location where the also has sensors. Or simulate the distant non-verlapping locations by deploying the second in a shielded environment connected to the valid network (Location 2). Spoof the MAC address of the in location 1 with the in location 2 and connect it to the whitelisted in location 2. Make sure that the time between connections is shorter than the time timeframe allowed/configured. Verify that the detected and generated an alert.

f-component.name: Wireless Intrusion Detection – Proprietary Traffic Monitoring

f-element.note: The "802.11 monitoring SFP" is a security function policy and the SFRs that reference this policy describe what the policy does. The "802.11 monitoring SFP" is established in and defined through SFRs. A vendor does not have to formally define this policy, it only needs to comply with the SFRs.

aactivity.TSS: There are no assurance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.

steplist.step: Set the sensor for a set channel.
Start a traffic capture from the sensor.

Send a set number of frames on the sensor's operating channel for all IEEE 802.11 a, b, g, n, ac vendor propietary frame types and subtypes from/to the following:
authorized s and authorized s.
authorized s and unauthorized s.
unauthorized s and authorized s.
Provide a list of the frames types and subtypos that were used for testing and verify that they were all detected.

f-element.title:
The shall allow an Authorized Administrator to isolate a wireless or from the network monitored by the using the following methods:
wireless containment wire-side containment of an unauthorized connected to the internal corporate wired network.
f-element.note:
It is expected that an Authorized Administrator will be responsible for confirming the or as a rogue or to initiate wireless containment.
In this SFR the containment of an an unauthorized connected to the internal corporate wired network refers to an unauthorized that is physically connected (via wire) to the protected internal wired infrastructure.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes a list of available containment methods on the and how to configure them.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Tests:
Configure the containment methods available on the and perform the following test for each method.
Deploy a non-whitelisted and connect to the protected wired infrastructure via wire (make sure it gets classified as rogue, or manually classify as such). Connect a whitelisted to the . Verify that generates an alert, breaks the connection of the whitelisted from the rogue , and contains the rogue .

f-component.name: Device Configuration - Monitoring Time and Frequency

f-element.title: The shall allow for the configuration of the time it monitors a specific frequency.
f-element.note: It is expected that an Authorized Administrator will be responsible for configuring the to operate on a specific frequency persuaent to the 802.11 standard. The will have the ability to adjust the amount of time it passively monitors and captures WLAN traffic on a given frequency and channel.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes a list of available containment methods on the and how to configure them.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test on the :
Deploy a whitelisted and connect it to the protected wired infrastructure via wire. Confirm that the can observe and capture traffic and events generated by the . Verify that the can be configured to capture traffic on a specific channel for specific interval of time, and assign a specified frequency and time interval. Confirm that the remains on the frequency and channel for the time period specified.

f-element.title: The shall allow for the for the export of all captured event logs.
f-element.note: It is expected that an Authorized Administrator will be responsible for providing event output from the for the purposes of ingest into other analysis and reporting mechanisms. Having the ability to export event log data from the device is a necessary capability to satisfy this requirement.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall verify that the includes a list of available containment methods on the and how to configure them.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test on the :
Deploy a whitelisted and connect it to the protected wired infrastructure via wire. Confirm that the can observe and capture traffic and events generated by the . Verify that the can export its configuration and observable event data in any of the following formats:
comma separated values (CSV)
common log format (CLF)
JavaScript Object Notation (JSON)
syslog

f-element.title:
The shall be able to generate a audit record of the following auditable events:
Start-up and shutdown of the functions;
All auditable events for the [not specified] level of audit;
[Auditable events listed in ;
Totals of similar events occurring within a specified time period]
RequirementAuditable EventsAdditional Audit Record Contents
NoneNone
NoneNone
NoneNone
NoneNone
NoneNone
whitelisted devices informationType of device ( or ), MAC Address.
NoneNone
Unexpected behavior by whitelisted device alertDescription of behavior detected (i.e., bridge, ICS connection), MAC address of whitelisted device, MAC address of the device that the whitelisted device made a connection with, connection start and end.
Information on location of deviceDevice MAC address, device type, classification of device, sensors that detected device, signal strength as received by detecting sensor(s), proximity to detecting sensor(s) (in meters).
Information on location of devicedevice MAC address, device type, classification of device, sensors that detected device, signal strength as received by detecting sensor(s), proximity to detecting sensor(s) (in meters).
Alert generated by detection of rogue device.Description of alert, type of device ( or ), MAC Address, associations made between authorized devices (which s are s connected to), channel detected on, RF Band detected on, encryption type used by rogue, IEEE 802.11 standard used (a, b, g, n, ac), SSID (if ).
Alert generated by detection of mac spoofing. Description of alert, type of device ( or ), MAC Address, associations made between authorized devices (which s are s connected to), channel detected on, RF Band detected on, encryption type used by rogue, IEEE 802.11 standard used (a, b, g, n, ac), SSID (if ).
Alert generated by detection of mac spoofing. Description of alert, location as labeled by administrator, time elapsed between connection in different locations, type of device ( or ), MAC Address, associations made between authorized devices (which s are s connected to), channel detected on, RF Band detected on, encryption type used by rogue, IEEE 802.11 standard used (a, b, g, n, ac), SSID (if ).

: Alerts
f-element.note:
The alerts table contains the contents of the alert produced by the . The Alert table includes optional and objective requirements. The auditing of optional and objective requirements is only required if the vendor chooses to have the requirement evaluated by NIAP.
With regards to ‘similar’ type events, 'similar’ events are multiple occurrences of the same auditable event within some time period where the only significant difference between these events is the timestamp. For example, it is not expected that the generate an individual audit message for every event of the same kind that occurs within a reasonable time period. An alert must, at a minum, include the details as outlined on the table, but may contain additional details.

aactivity.TSS: There are no assurance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Guidance: There are no operational guidance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
The evaluator shall test the ’s ability to correctly generate audit records by having the generate audit records in accordance with the assurance activities associated with the functional requirements in this . When verifying the test results, the evaluator shall ensure the audit records generated during testing match the format specified in the administrative guide, and that the fields in each audit record have the proper entries.
Note that the testing here can be accomplished in conjunction with the testing of the security mechanisms directly.

f-element.title:
The shall record within each auditable event as comma separated values (CSV) common log format (CLF) JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) syslog
at least the following information:
Date and time of the event, type of event, and subject identity (if applicable);
For each audit event type, based on the auditable event definitions of the functional components included in the PP/ST, [auditable events listed in Table 4].

aactivity.TSS: There are no assurance activities for this SFR.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance describes how to configure the to result in applicable data logging. The evaluator shall verify that the operational guidance provides instructions for any configuration that may be done in regard to logging similar events (e.g., setting thresholds, defining time windows, etc.).
aactivity.Tests:
The evaluator shall perform the following test:
The evaluator shall test that the alerts yield the expected / audit data in the format selected in the for each auditable event in table 4. Note that the testing here can be accomplished in conjunction with the testing of the security mechanisms directly.

f-component.name: Basic Internal TSF Data Transfer Protection

f-element.title: The shall preserve a secure state when the following types of failures occur: [sensor functionality failure, potential compromise of the ].
f-element.note: At minimum, the preservation of a secure state requires the generation of audit records when the defined failure conditions occur.

aactivity.TSS: The evaluator shall review the section to determine that the ’s implementation of the fail secure functionality is documented. The evaluator shall examine the section to ensure that all failure modes specified in the are described.
aactivity.Guidance: The evaluator shall review the operational guidance to verify that it identifies the potential failures, how the preserves a secure state following these failures, and any actions that are required to restore the to normal operation following the transition to a failure state.

testlist.test: For each failure mode specified in the , the evaluator shall ensure that the attains a secure state after initiating each failure mode type.
